news-item.title: Comfort Intech in its biggest trailing week gain for 3 weeks
news-item.source: Indian Company News Bites - Stock Report
news-item.text:
STOCK REPORT Comfort Intech Ltd. (BSE:531216), India's 61st largest finance/non-bank financial company (nbfc) by market capitalisation, lifted Rs0.05 (or 3.3%) to close at Rs1.55. In the past week the shares have jumped 7.6%, the biggest trailing week gain since February 28. Compared with the BSE Sensex Index which rose 22.8 points (or 0.1%) in the day, this represented a relative price increase of 3.2%. To download our Detailed Research Report (PDF), giving comprehensive trading and background information on Comfort Intech, please click http://www.buysellsignals.com/001051141660314531216 Bullish SignalsUptrend- The stock rose 3.3% on high volatility today and expanding price range.- In the last three months the stock has hit a new 52-week high six times, pointing to an uptrend. - The present value of Rs1,000 (PV1000) invested one year ago in Comfort Intech is Rs1,550, including a capital gain of Rs520 and dividend reinvested of Rs30. Fundamental measures by comparison with the sector average [in brackets] indicate Undervaluation:- Price/Earnings of 7 [8.9]. - Price/Sales of 1.5 [1.7]. - Return on Equity 2.9% [0.4%].- Return on Capital Employed 6.8% [0.9%].Other Bullish Signals:- Total Liabilities/EBITDA of 3.3 is comfortably below 5, this compares favourably with the Joseph Piotroski benchmark of 5. - The P/E of 7 multiplied by the P/NTA of 0.5 is 3.8. Being less than the Benjamin Graham benchmark of 22.5 the stock appears undervalued. - The company is cash rich with Cash to Market Capitalisation at 24.5%. - Tobin's Q Ratio, defined as MCap divided by Total Assets, is 0.4. Compared with the rest of the market the stock is undervalued.- As per the Du Pont analysis, Return on Equity is less than stellar at 2.9%. This is computed as net profit margin of 17.2% times asset turnover [sales/assets] of 0.14 times leverage factor [total assets/shareholders' equity] of 1.2.- Net Profit margin, EBIT margin and EBITDA margin are positive and have seen consecutive rises in recent years.[Year ended, all figures in %]
Bearish SignalsFundamental measures by comparison with the sector average [in brackets] indicate Overvaluation:- Year-on-Year Earnings Growth of 14.3% [36.2%].- Price/Earnings/Growth of 0.5 [0.2].- Dividend yield of 1.3% [2.4%].- Price to EBITDA of 7.8 [3.1].Other Bearish Signals:- Net profit margin has averaged 10.5% in the last 3 years. This is lower than the sector average of 19.8% and suggests a low margin of safety. NoteVolume: there were 12,332 shares worth Rs18,764 (US$308) traded. The volume was 0.1 times the average trading of 154,230 shares. - Comfort Intech is at a discount of 27.9% to its 12-month high of Rs2.15 on 12 Feb, 2014. It is also at a premium of 104.0% to the 12-month low of Rs0.76 on 03 Sep, 2013.
